title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Imanol Rios-Franco and Brandon Baez were sentenced for bank fraud and mail theft in Massachusetts.
Rios-Franco received 35 months in prison and must pay $12,528 in restitution; Baez received 24 months and $10,285 restitution.
The scheme involved stealing and altering checks from USPS boxes, using chemicals to wash ink, then redepositing them.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Marcelo Gomes da Silva, detained by ICE last year, is invited to attend the State of the Union address.
Rep. Seth Moulton, who invited Gomes, criticized the immigration system as flawed in a public statement.
Gomes, from Brazil, detained as a 'collateral arrest' while ICE targeted his father, highlighting deportation practices.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a center-ice goal in Team USA's win against Denmark during his first Olympic start.
Swayman humorously addressed the goal, attributing it to a visual issue and joking about being colorblind.
The U.S. defeated Denmark despite Swayman's performance, with potentially more goaltender rotations in the upcoming games.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Boston Celtics star Jayson Tatum is nearing a return from his Achilles injury, drawing comments from NBA peers.
Kevin Durant, who recovered from a similar injury, expects Tatum to display All-Star level performance upon his return.
Carmelo Anthony believes Tatum's return will bolster the Celtics' playoff chances, easing his reintegration into the lineup.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million in cap space and seek impactful free agents to strengthen weaknesses.
Potential targets include Colts WR Alec Pierce, known for his big-play ability and 1,003-yard season.
Other options are Packers OT Rasheed Walker, Bills C Connor McGovern, Ravens TE Isaiah Likely, and Eagles EDGE Jaelan Phillips.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN becomes MLB.TV's new streaming platform, offering it as an add-on service at $134.99 for ESPN Unlimited subscribers.
Non-subscribers of ESPN Unlimited can access MLB.TV for $149.99, which includes a free trial month of ESPN Unlimited.
Current MLB.TV subscribers will automatically renew, with options to link subscriptions to ESPN's app for streaming.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a practice with the Celtics’ G League affiliate, boosting speculation about his potential return.
Celtics guard Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement about Tatum's progress but did not confirm a return timeline.
Jayson Tatum is recovering from an Achilles tear and has been ruled out for games this season without a set return date.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts was ranked the most educated state in the U.S. in WalletHub's 2026 Most & Least Educated States report.
The state excels with 47% of adults holding a bachelor's degree and nearly 22% with graduate or professional degrees.
Vermont and Maryland followed in second and third places; Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia ranked lowest.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction — and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare Honus Wagner baseball card is up for auction, with a current bid of $3.9 million, closing February 21.
The card, kept by the Bernstein family for 116 years, is significant for its ungraded status and Massachusetts ties.
Ken Goldin of Netflix's "King of Collectibles" discovered the card, which might sell for over $6 million at auction.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Bruins goalie Jeremy Swayman will make his Olympic debut starting for Team USA against Denmark on Saturday.
Swayman contributed to a Team USA win in the 2025 IIHF World Championship and has a 22-12-3 record this season.
Swayman will join Bruins teammate Charlie McAvoy, as Connor Hellebuyck will be Swayman's backup for the game.
